business.headline: Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is the stock market rising today?At 10:33 am, the NSE Nifty50 surged 171.25 points to 25,966.40, while the BSE Sensex jumped 575.03 points to 84,786.91. Broader market indices also traded higher, mirroring the upbeat sentiment on Dalal Street.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: What's making precious metals lose their shine?Gold and silver prices are slipping after a strong two-month rally. Here's why the dollar's strength, easing tensions, and Fed expectations are cooling off investor appetite for bullion.

Sensex, Nifty rise as US trade deal hopes lift market moodAt 9:30 am, the BSE Sensex surged 306.28 points to 84,518.16, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 97.55 points to 25,892.70. Most broader market indices also traded higher in early deals, even as market volatility showed a mild uptick.

Luxury vs affordable housing: What homebuyers prefer during festive seasonThe festive months are traditionally seen as an auspicious time to buy homes. But as real estate sentiment rises across cities, one question stands out — are buyers chasing luxury spaces or choosing affordability amid rising costs?

LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

How Piyush Pandey made India fall in love with adsPiyush Pandey transformed Indian advertising with heartfelt stories and local flavour. His campaigns blended wit and emotion, leaving a lasting cultural impact.

Remembering Piyush Pandey: The ad legend who made brands immortalFor over four decades, the Jaipur-born storyteller reshaped Indian advertising, turning simple commercials into cultural phenomena and making brands like Fevicol, Cadbury, and Asian Paints inseparable from the Indian consciousness.​

CA explains why saving before spending works best for financial stabilityWhile most people save whatever is left after spending, CA Meenal Goel flips the approach. Her mantra, prioritise savings before expenses, has helped her stay financially secure and stress-free.

Error in your ITR filing? Here's how to correct it with an updated returnRealised there's an error in your ITR after submission? You're not alone. Many taxpayers make small mistakes while filing, but the good news is — you can still correct them through an updated return.

Why the world's central banks are buying gold like never beforeNot just households and investors, but central banks around the globe are buying gold like it's Dhanteras every day. So why are the world's biggest buyers going for bullion? Read on to find out.
Target announces 1,800 job cuts in a decade amid falling salesAll corporate employees in the US have been asked to work from home next week as the company finalises its restructuring process.

entertainment.headline: Kantara 2 beats Chhaava to top 2025 box office, puts Rishab Shetty in big league Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has officially become the highest-grossing Indian film of 2025, surpassing 'Chhaava' worldwide. The mythological actioner, produced by Hombale Films, continues its blockbuster run with record-breaking numbers in Karnataka and across India.

ASTRO's Cha Eun Woo teases haunting solo album 'ELSE' in new video South Korean singer Cha Eun Woo releases teaser for upcoming solo mini album 'ELSE', set for November 21, 2025. The album was completed prior to his military enlistment and explores a darker, more emotional theme.

Korean filmmaker Shin Sung-Hoon found dead at 40, funeral held without family South Korean filmmaker Shin Sung-Hoon, known for 'Jajangmyeon Thank You' and 'Underage', has died at 40. His death, revealed months later, has shaken the industry after reports that his funeral was held without any family present.

June Lockhart, beloved star of Lassie and Lost in Space, dies at 100 Hollywood icon June Lockhart, known for her roles in 'Lassie' and 'Lost in Space', died at 100. She died in Santa Monica surrounded by family, leaving behind a legacy of grace on screen.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Aadhirai evicted, Vijay Sethupathi exposes Kamrudin's lies Bigg Boss Tamil 9 Sunday episode saw Vijay Sethupathi exposing Kamrudin's violent behaviour and lies. The episode ended with Aadhirai's eviction and the contestants reflecting on the host's criticisms.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office Day 6: Harshvardhan's film crosses Rs 40 crore 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', starring Harshvardhan Rane and Sonam Bajwa, has recovered its budget within four days and crossed Rs 40 crore nett in its first weekend. The romantic drama continues to perform well despite competition from 'Thamma'.

Toxic hero returns: Struggling mainstream cinema's answer to shocking Insta reels The Diwali release 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' is doing brisk business and seems to follow a trend brought back by 'Animal'. There's more to come

Thamma box office Day 6: Ayushmann-Rashmika film enters Rs 100-crore club globally 'Thamma', starring Ayushmann Khurrana, Rashmika Mandanna, and Nawazuddin Siddiqui, continues its strong box office run, earning Rs 91.70 crore nett domestically. The film has also crossed the Rs 100 crore mark worldwide in just five days.

Exclusive: Karanvir Bohra says micro dramas are the new binge culture Actor Karanvir Bohra is exploring micro dramas with Pocket TV's 'Ek Tha Deewana'. The vertical format challenges traditional storytelling with its fast pace and tight framing.

Exclusive: Enrique Iglesias to be treated to Indian curries and culture during India tour Spanish singer-songwriter Enrique Iglesias returns to India for concerts in Mumbai this October. The tour blends music with rich Indian culinary experiences and cultural visits.

Chris Martin seen on secret date with Sophie Turner after Dakota split Singer Chris Martin and Sophie Turner were seen together after ending previous relationships. Both recently had significant relationship changes in their personal lives.

Not October 31, Baahubali The Epic to arrive two days early. Watch Director SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Epic' was scheduled for a grand release on October 31. However, actor Prabhas announced that the film will arrive two days early in a special video.

Lily Allen hints at open marriage with Stranger Things star David Harbour Lily Allen discusses evolving definitions of intimacy and monogamy in recent interviews.  She hints at an open marriage with David Harbour and references relationship challenges in her album.

Pitch To Get Rich is Shark Tank for fashion industry, but should you watch? 'Pitch To Get Rich' is currently streaming on JioHotstar. Featuring 14 fashion entrepreneurs and starry guest judges, including Karan Johar, Manish Malhotra and Malaika Arora, is the show worth a watch? Let's find out here.

Rakhi Sawant says, compare me to Shakira, Kim K, JLo, not Urvashi Rautela Rakhi Sawant dismissed comparisons with Urvashi Rautela while promoting her new song 'Zaroorat'. Sawant showcased jewellery she claimed was worth Rs 70 crore at the event.

Sydney Sweeney says she's excited to meet Kim Novak before biopic role Actor Sydney Sweeney will soon meet Kim Novak before playing her in 'Scandalous!', a film about Novak's romance with Sammy Davis Jr.  The biopic, directed by Colman Domingo, explores the challenges Novak faced during her Hollywood career in the 1950s.

Demi Moore says Tom Cruise was embarrassed by her pregnancy in A Few Good Men Hollywood star Demi Moore recalls Tom Cruise feeling "embarrassed" by her pregnancy during the pre-production of 'A Few Good Men'. The actor describes pressures to balance motherhood with her acting career in Hollywood at the time.

Austin Butler in talks to play Sonny Crockett in Miami Vice movie: Report Actor Austin Butler is in early talks to take on the role of Sonny Crockett in Universal's upcoming 'Miami Vice' film. The film is set to explore the mid-1980s Miami scene, drawing inspiration from the NBC television series.

We don't stage grief: Ishitta Arun defends laughter at Piyush Pandey's funeral Ishitta Arun addressed criticism for laughing at uncle Piyush Pandey's funeral, saying it was her way of celebrating his lively spirit and that grief can be expressed in different ways.

general news.headline: Pak-Afghan peace talks deadlocked over Taliban's 'illogical stance': ReportThe second round of talks in Istanbul on Saturday came a week after the initial negotiations in Doha, held in the wake of the October 16 ceasefire that ended the deadliest clashes between the two sides since the Taliban took control of Afghanistan in 2021.

Indian woman raped in 'racially aggravated' attack in UK, suspect caught on CCTVThe police confirmed that the woman was assaulted because of her racial identity. They released a picture of the suspect and appealed to locals for active cooperation.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: What's making precious metals lose their shine?Gold and silver prices are slipping after a strong two-month rally. Here's why the dollar's strength, easing tensions, and Fed expectations are cooling off investor appetite for bullion.

Cyclone Montha set to hit Andhra coast tomorrow, Odisha begins evacuationCyclone Montha, brewing over the Bay of Bengal, is set to make landfall near Kakinada on October 28 as a severe cyclonic storm with winds up to 110 kmph. Massive evacuation, relief, and preparedness measures are underway across Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, and West Bengal amid forecasts of heavy rainfall and rough sea conditions.

Bamiyan Buddhas fell to Taliban rockets, rest is being destroyed now. Here's howTwo decades after the two Buddha statues were destroyed by the Taliban, the Buddhist caves of Bamiyan are in a state of ruin. Once a monastery complex where Buddhist monks lived and meditated along the Silk Route, at least 130 of Bamiyan's caves have now been taken over by families hit by poverty and war in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan.

Bangladesh to give red carpet welcome to Zakir Naik 9 years after Dhaka attackAccording to event organisers, the tour, scheduled from November 28 to December 20, 2025, has been officially approved by the government and is being facilitated by officials. Zakir Naik is expected to deliver a series of sermons across the country during his stay.

JD Vance's wife not Muslim: Trump ally snaps at journalist's 'brown people' jabBritish-American journalist Mehdi Hasan condemned Vice President JD Vance for "publicly mocking other Brown people" despite being married to Indian-origin Usha Vance. In response, Trump ally Laura Loomer pointed out that the Vice President's "wife isn't a Muslim."

Toxic hero returns: Struggling mainstream cinema's answer to shocking Insta reelsThe Diwali release 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' is doing brisk business and seems to follow a trend brought back by 'Animal'. There's more to come

Farmer dies after BJP leader, aides run Thar over him, assault his daughtersA BJP leader and 14 others have been booked for allegedly killing farmer Ram Swaroop Dhakad by running a vehicle over him and assaulting his daughters in Ganeshpura, Madhya Pradesh.

TVK chief Vijay meets Karur stampede victims' families at Mamallapuram resortAt least 41 people were killed and more than 60 others injured in the tragic stampede that occurred at a rally in Karur addressed by actor-politician Vijay on September 27.

Lesson for them: Madhya Pradesh minister's shocker on cricketers' molestationKailash Vijayvargiya faces intense backlash for his remarks on the molestation of Australian women cricketers in Indore, suggesting that players should exercise caution while travelling and notify local authorities or security personnel in advance.

British man asks why National Museum of India has few artefacts, gets savage responseIn a video, a British vlogger was seen walking through the galleries of the National Museum of India with a fellow traveller.

Exclusive: Enrique Iglesias to be treated to Indian curries and culture during India tourSpanish singer-songwriter Enrique Iglesias returns to India for concerts in Mumbai this October. The tour blends music with rich Indian culinary experiences and cultural visits.

Man poses as Army officer, drugs and rapes Delhi doctor he met onlineA delivery person impersonating an Indian Army lieutenant raped a doctor after gaining her trust on social media. He was later arrested in the Chhattarpur area in Delhi.

Jujitsu player Rohini Kalam dies by suicide, sister links death to work stressInternational jujitsu player Rohini Kalam, who represented India at the 2022 Asian Games, was found dead at her home in Dewas. Police suspect suicide and have launched an investigation into the circumstances of her death.

Isro to launch CMS-03 satellite: How it will boost India's ocean commsThe CMS-03 is a multi-band communication satellite developed by Isro, designed to provide robust telecommunication coverage across India.

Techies by day, cabbies at night: Why Bengaluru engineers are driving Ola, UberEver had cab drivers in Bengaluru answer your call in fluent corporate lingo? Chances are, they might have been techies. It's not just for the money. Software engineers are driving cabs to beat loneliness at home and drudgery at the office, revealing a problem in our corporate culture.

Poll body to announce pan-India SIR dates today, 10-15 states likely in Phase 1The poll body is expected to unveil the first phase of the SIR, covering 10 to 15 states, including those scheduled for Assembly elections in 2026. Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Kerala, Assam, and Puducherry are among the states set to go to the polls next year.

How micro-meditation helps you manage stress in minutesFeeling stressed and anxious but struggling to find time for a full meditation session in your busy day? Take a mini pause, it's just as effective.

Pitch To Get Rich is Shark Tank for fashion industry, but should you watch?'Pitch To Get Rich' is currently streaming on JioHotstar. Featuring 14 fashion entrepreneurs and starry guest judges, including Karan Johar, Manish Malhotra and Malaika Arora, is the show worth a watch? Let's find out here.

Law student's head slashed, stomach ripped open, fingers cut over payment disputeIn Kanpur, 22-year-old LLB student Abhijeet Singh Chandel was brutally attacked with a cleaver by a medical store owner and his associates over a payment dispute. The assault left his head slashed, stomach ripped open, intestines exposed, and fingers severed.

Acid attack on Delhi University student near college; stalker, 2 others on the runPolice said her stalker, Jitender, and two associates threw acid on her as she walked to class. The victim suffered burns on both hands and is being treated at a local hospital.

US deepening ties with Pak won't come at cost of India relations: Marco RubioUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio emphasises the US commitment to strengthening ties with both India and Pakistan without compromising historic relations. He highlights the strategic balance Washington seeks amid evolving regional dynamics.

sports.headline: Rohit reflects on unprecedented 5-month break, rediscovering game his own way Australia vs India: Speaking to the BCCI after his match-winning hundred in Sydney, Rohit Sharma credited the work he put in during his five-month break for his strong comeback. Rohit shed 11 kilograms while working on his fitness and refining his skills in Mumbai ahead of the Australia tour.

Ajinkya Rahane fires shots at Agarkar, says India missed him in Australia Batter Ajinkya Rahane hit out at the Indian Cricket Board after a marathon 159-run knock against Chhattisgarh on Sunday. Rahane called out the selectors for snubbing him from tour of Australia.

Jujitsu player Rohini Kalam dies by suicide, sister links death to work stress International jujitsu player Rohini Kalam, who represented India at the 2022 Asian Games, was found dead at her home in Dewas. Police suspect suicide and have launched an investigation into the circumstances of her death.

Radha Yadav alive and kicking, puts her hand up for Australia semi-final Women's World Cup: Radha Yadav delivered a stunning performance against Bangladesh, taking three wickets for 30 runs. She also effected a brilliant run-out of Nigar Sultana Joty, showcasing why she is widely regarded as one of India's fittest cricketers and a top-class fielder.

Pat Cummins to miss first Ashes Test, but Australia upbeat on his recovery Ashes 2025-26: Australia on Monday confirmed that their captain Pat Cummins will miss the first Test, starting November 21, against England in Perth. Steve Smith will lead the side in the fast bowler's absence.

Security intensified in Navi Mumbai after Australian players' harassment in Indore The security has been intensified in Navi Mumbai for the remaining games of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 in the aftermath of the molestation incident involving Australian cricketers in Indore.

Jannik Sinner wins Vienna Open title after fighting back to beat Alexander Zverev Vienna Open: Jannik Sinner beat Germany's Alexander Zverev 3-6, 6-3, 7-5 in the final on Sunday, securing his fourth ATP Tour title of the season. Sinner has now won 21 consecutive matches on indoor hardcourts.

Why the Chess World Cup 2025 could shape the future of Indian chess The Chess World Cup 2025 is a crucial tournament for India's players. With the home advantage, they must make the most of this opportunity to ensure the continued strength and depth of Indian chess in the coming years.

Premier League: Arsenal extend lead at the top, Manchester City suffer loss Arsenal secured a narrow victory over Crystal Palace, thanks to Eberechi Eze's first league goal for the club on Sunday, October 26. Manchester City's winning run came to an end against Aston Villa as Matty Cash's goal proved to be decisive.

El Clasico: Real Madrid down Barcelona 2-1 to extend lead at top of LaLiga Kylian Mbappe and Jude Bellingham were on target as Real Madrid beat Barcelona 2-1 to strengthen their spot at the top of the LaLiga points table. Barca were left to rue their chances and lost Pedri to a red card in the final moments of the game.

Pratika Rawal freak injury: Harmanpreet Kaur shares an update on India opener Women's World Cup, IND vs BAN: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur shared an update on Pratika Rawal, who sustained an injury during the clash against Bangladesh at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Jannik Sinner wins Vienna Open title after fighting back to beat Alexander Zverev Vienna Open: Jannik Sinner beat Germany's Alexander Zverev 3-6, 6-3, 7-5 in the final on Sunday, securing his fourth ATP Tour title of the season. Sinner has now won 21 consecutive matches on indoor hardcourts.

Why the Chess World Cup 2025 could shape the future of Indian chess The Chess World Cup 2025 is a crucial tournament for India's players. With the home advantage, they must make the most of this opportunity to ensure the continued strength and depth of Indian chess in the coming years.

Premier League: Arsenal extend lead at the top, Manchester City suffer loss Arsenal secured a narrow victory over Crystal Palace, thanks to Eberechi Eze's first league goal for the club on Sunday, October 26. Manchester City's winning run came to an end against Aston Villa as Matty Cash's goal proved to be decisive.

El Clasico: Real Madrid down Barcelona 2-1 to extend lead at top of LaLiga Kylian Mbappe and Jude Bellingham were on target as Real Madrid beat Barcelona 2-1 to strengthen their spot at the top of the LaLiga points table. Barca were left to rue their chances and lost Pedri to a red card in the final moments of the game.

Pratika Rawal freak injury: Harmanpreet Kaur shares an update on India opener Women's World Cup, IND vs BAN: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur shared an update on Pratika Rawal, who sustained an injury during the clash against Bangladesh at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Chess World Cup 2025: Decoding the format of the tournamentThe Chess World Cup 2025 will be played from October 31, 2025 to November 27, 2025 and this represents a golden chance for the Indian Chess grandmasters to seal their spot in the Candidates 2026 tournament.

Pratika Rawal's injury mars India's washed-out group finale against BangladeshIndia's group stage campaign came to an end with an abandoned fixture against Bangladesh in Navi Mumbai. A game which saw 36.4 overs in total was dominated by India before incessant rain denied them a win, which was just 69 runs away.

Amy Jones lauds England spin-depth as focus shifts to semi-final showdownAmy Jones praised England's spinners for a brilliant collective performance that helped restrict New Zealand, highlighting the team's depth and adaptability. With the semi-final against South Africa in Guwahati next, she emphasised focus and confidence heading into the clash.

Sophie Devine on ODI retirement after NZ vs ENG: Proud of making this decisionSophie Devine said that she is proud to call time on her career after retiring from ODIs after New Zealand's final game of the Women's World Cup 2025 against England. Devine played 159 ODIs for the White Ferns.

Pratika Rawal suffers freak injury in big blow for India before semisWomen's World Cup 2025: India has suffered a big injury scare ahead of the semifinal clash against Australia, with their star opener, Pratika Rawak, suffering an injury during the final league match against Bangladesh.

After India Test team snub, Nair makes statement with 25th first-class hundredKarun Nair sent a message to the selectors by scoring his 25th first-class century during the Ranji trophy clash against Goa on Sunday, October 26. Nair remained unbeaten on 174 as Karnataka put up 371 runs in the first innings.

Rahane's message to Sarfaraz Khan amid selection row: Keep your head down and focusAjinkya Rahane scored a commanding 159 in the Ranji Trophy and shared advice for Sarfaraz Khan. His message stresses patience and focus amid ongoing national team selection challenges.

Why Sophie Devine denied teammates from giving guard honour before England tieNew Zealand captain Sophie Devine explained why she refused her teammates from giving a guard of honour before the England tie on Sunday, October 26. Devine called time on her ODI career with the game in Vizag.

Pratika Rawal suffers freak injury in big blow for India before semisWomen's World Cup 2025: India has suffered a big injury scare ahead of the semifinal clash against Australia, with their star opener, Pratika Rawak, suffering an injury during the final league match against Bangladesh.

After India Test team snub, Nair makes statement with 25th first-class hundredKarun Nair sent a message to the selectors by scoring his 25th first-class century during the Ranji trophy clash against Goa on Sunday, October 26. Nair remained unbeaten on 174 as Karnataka put up 371 runs in the first innings.

Rahane's message to Sarfaraz Khan amid selection row: Keep your head down and focusAjinkya Rahane scored a commanding 159 in the Ranji Trophy and shared advice for Sarfaraz Khan. His message stresses patience and focus amid ongoing national team selection challenges.

Why Sophie Devine denied teammates from giving guard honour before England tieNew Zealand captain Sophie Devine explained why she refused her teammates from giving a guard of honour before the England tie on Sunday, October 26. Devine called time on her ODI career with the game in Vizag.

Sophie Ecclestone injured before semis? Nat Sciver-Brunt updates on England spinnerWomen's World Cup, ENG vs NZ: Left-arm spinner Sophie Ecclestone bowled only four balls in her spell in New Zealand's innings in Visakhapatnam before she went off the park due to a shoulder injury.

Riyan Parag leads Assam to script unwanted record in Ranji Trophy historyRiyan Parag starred with the ball as Assam fell to a heavy defeat against Services, scripting an unwanted Ranji Trophy record despite his valiant efforts.

Celebrate Virat Kohli, let him find balance in life at end of career: AB de VilliersAB de Villiers has urged the fans to celebrate Virat Kohli and support him, irrespective of what decision he makes in terms of his career. Kohli came back into form during the third ODI against Australia.

Harmanpreet Kaur is my idol, 171 against Australia inspired me: Sobhana MostaryWomen's World Cup 2025: In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, Bangladesh batter Sobhana Mostary said that she idolises Harmanpreet Kaur and started following her since the 171-run knock against Australia in the semi-finals of the 2017 edition in Derby.

Arne Slot gives bizarre reason for Liverpool's pricey yet poor formLiverpool's Premier League title defence has hit a worrying slump after four straight defeats. Arne Slot blamed the team's away-heavy schedule and rival tactics for their poor form, calling it a key reason behind the slide.

Australian Cricketers Molested On Indore Street | Molester ArrestedThis special report covers the shocking incident in Indore where two Australian women cricketers, in India for the ICC Women's World Cup, were stalked and molested. According to the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Secretary Devajit Saikia, 'It is a very unfortunate incident that brings disrepute'. The incident occurred when the players were walking from their hotel to a cafe, prompting immediate police action. An FIR was lodged and the accused, identified as Akil Khan, was arrested based on a bystander's tip. The report delves into the political fallout and the serious questions raised about the safety of international athletes and women in India, an act that has brought global shame during a major tournament.

England and New Zealand give Sophie Devine guard of honour in emotional ODI farewellWomen's World Cup 2025: Sophie Devine received a guard of honour from both teams in her final ODI, capped by a special jersey from England, closing a stellar career that included 4,000+ runs and a T20 World Cup triumph as New Zealand captain.

One last time: Rohit Sharma signs off from Australia, heads back to IndiaIndia's star batter Rohit Sharma signed off for one last time from Australia after his heroics during the recently-concluded ODI series. Rohit was adjudged as the Player Of The Series for his heroics with the bat.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
